1.Pros: Some of the upsides to working at this store/company are everyone is like family and a lot of us have known each other for years. We worked well as a store and for the most part with each other. The owners seemed to care about you and your well-being.
1.Cons: Some of the Cons working at this job are they are not very professional. The mangers picked favorites.

2.Cons: Can be stressful in busy times.

3.Pros: The working environment is always energetic. There will be coffee and snacks.
3.Cons: The Work is repetitive, but it was probably because I am an intern and I just stayed for a short time.

4.Summary: "Nice to advance, but maybe not stay?"
4.Pros: Easy to get on, many opportunities for advancement; I started off there as cashier for my very first job, left as a Department Head of Guest Services(management), for crew HIGHLY negotiable hours- managers a little less but still easy to work a good schedule (although this does depend on the GM [the good ones work with you]. A very good place to get work experience in both hard and soft skills.
4.Cons: Constantly on-call, low volume stores have big worries about labor so large potential for being sent home early, High turnover so the constant worry of, "Is so-and-so going to show up for their shift?" especially frustrating when they're your replacement. If you become a manager expect to have to shift your life to revolve around your job.

5.Pros: eh, good people to work with, I have nothing else to say. free meal with shift.
5.Cons: will not give enough hours, labor intensive, food is terrible, horrible customers

6.Cons: employee attitudes aren't always addressed to provide good service

7.Pros: The money is consistent and the pay is far you always receive your money on time and last but not least it's a reliable source of income
7.Cons: the customer service is poor at times and the customers are extremely rude and you are expected to take the disrespect with a smile

8.Pros: I worked with a wonderful group of people who helped teach me the tools and skills needed to succed in any job venue.
8.Cons: Low pay and veribal bashing by the customers on a continual basis. Having to sacrifice service in order for corporate to make a few extra bucks.

9.Pros: Fun great first job and easy.
9.Cons: Fast paced on your feet and busy
